body_html:
I think there are two problems being reported, correct me if I misunderstand.

  1. The warning reported above by @Alderasus and @Thiel. I see that a change was submitted to cuda_driver.cc on Aug 7 that changed this warning, claiming that the old one included false positive warnings.

c67e2c9

Perhaps you could retry with a more recent version of TF to see whether you're still getting a warning.

  1. thiel@ is experiencing slower performance with 2 GPUs than with 1 for cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py. I'm not familiar with this program, but maybe @nealwu is. Are you seeing both GPUs being used (e.g. using nvidia-smi, or looking at the device assignments in the logged .pbtxt showing the graph)? If the python part of the process is indeed the bottleneck, can you tell which part, e.g. input preprocessing?

body:
I think there are two problems being reported, correct me if I misunderstand.

1. The warning reported above by @alderasus and @thiel.  I see that a change was submitted to cuda_driver.cc on Aug 7 that changed this warning, claiming that the old one included false positive warnings.

https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/commit/c67e2c911c9a76942c25a76d37f0568a755010e6

Perhaps you could retry with a more recent version of TF to see whether you're still getting a warning.

2. thiel@ is experiencing slower performance with 2 GPUs than with 1 for cifar10_multi_gpu_train.py.  I'm not familiar with this program, but maybe @nealwu is.   Are you seeing both GPUs being used (e.g. using nvidia-smi, or looking at the device assignments in the logged .pbtxt showing the graph)?  If the python part of the process is indeed the bottleneck, can you tell which part, e.g. input preprocessing?
